alert.note: Alert for Meriwether; Pike; Upson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 26 at 10:15AM EDT until March 26 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHERN MERIWETHER, SOUTHERN PIKE AND NORTHWESTERN UPSON COUNTIES... At 1015 AM EDT, Radar, spotter reports and automated rain gauges indicated between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding and washed out roads have been reported. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing and expected to worsen. Avoid all unnecessary travel! HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Thomaston, Zebulon, Manchester, Woodbury, Warm Springs, Molena, Meansville, Sunset Village, Crest, Sunnyside, Raleigh, Atwater, Lifsey Springs, Hannahs Mill, Harris City and Durand. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Avoid all unnecessary travel! Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
